Author: Bappo#0069
Content:
so my friend has ubuntu on his laptop which i guess is a linix thing. We did all the code up to cd ~
git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo
cd komodo
git checkout dev
./zcutil/fetch-params.sh. How do you go down lines like that on ubuntu. It won't let us copy and paste either

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: what do I do?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what was the last command you issued?

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev m4 g++-multilib autoconf libtool ncurses-dev unzip git python zlib1g-dev wget bsdmainutils automake libboost-all-dev libssl-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libgtest-dev libqt4-dev libqrencode-dev libdb++-dev ntp ntpdate vim software-properties-common curl libcurl4-gnutls-dev cmake clang

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: no

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: not that

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: oh

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: wait

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: this

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev m4 g++-multilib autoconf libtool ncurses-dev unzip

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: thats not the whole thing

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: we messed up, do we start over or just re do the correct command?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you need to follow the guide and issue the  commands 1 line each time after installing all dependencies

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: do we start over or just re do the correct command'

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: yes

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: to what

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: starting over

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: or re doing the command?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: because, you didn't install all the deps

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: so start over..

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: start over

Author: Bappo#0069
Content: ok, thanks

Author: Bappo#0069
Content:
when I put in cd ~
git clone https://github.com/nanomsg/nanomsg
cd nanomsg
cmake . -DNN_TESTS=OFF -DNN_ENABLE_DOC=OFF
make -j2
sudo make install
sudo ldconfig it says "Command 'cmake' not found, but can be installed with: sudo apt install cmake

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: so, you need to use `sudo apt install cmake` to install cmake first
